Definition.WordDefinition:
Crusader \Cru*sad"er\ (-s?"d?r), n. One engaged in a crusade; as, the crusaders of the Middle Ages. [1913 Webster]
Azure-eyed and golden-haired, Forth the young crusaders fared. --Longfellow. [1913 Webster]
crusader n 1: a disputant who advocates reform [syn: {reformer}, {reformist}, {meliorist}] 2: a warrior who engages in a holy war; "the crusaders tried to recapture the Holy Land from the Muslims"
